page.title: 20NEWCASTLE AIRPORT
page.content: { Newcastle Airport}was first built in 1935.It was opened by{Sir Philip {Cuncliffe_Lister}who was the secretary of State for Air.Thirty two years later the airport was redeveloped with a{terminal building}provided.This was opened by The Right Honourable Harold Wilson.In 1946 at the outbreak of the Second World War,the R.A.F. took over the airport.Passenger flights began at about 1950. A{new runway}emerged using the best{navigational} equipment.The runway is{2332}metres long and 46 metres wide.At{Newcastle Airport}there is a fire station incase of of any serious accidents or fires.These usually occur when an aeroplane takes off or lands. Newcastle Airport sends flights to many cities such as Amsterdam,Paris and Copenhagen.
